title: What if smartphones were invented in the 1980s and 90s? - Quora

response.answer_text: Nokia had cell phones on the market in the ‘80s”  (Google) Car phones are even older. Ship-to-shore communications has been available since… forever or something. One might ask: “What if we could afford cell phones in the ’80s and ‘90s? (nota bene): Before cell phones, rich kids carried pagers.  Faster, pageboy… faster! WRT to hand-held doodads, who cares whether this device can tell time?  (Google Images) …mine is not for sale.

They were, in a sense, because they were conceptualized long before they were designed and marketed in the mid/late '00s. Anyone could have seen it coming. Some precursor products were things like the Apple Newton in the early '90s and the iPod in the early '00s. A smartphone is really nothing other than the convergence of cellular phone technology, and infrastructural deployment, with small, handheld devices. Both of these were already on the scene by the late '80s and into the '90s. Anyone with a vision knew what was coming … it was just a matter of who would design the first successful one, and when it would make it to market. Unsuprisingly it was Steve Jobs who pushed it through, catching Google and its Android project flatfooted.
